intro: Appendicula reflexa var. cycloglossa, commonly known as the cycloglossa appendicula, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the Violaceae family and is characterized by its small, showy violet-like flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves are ovate with a distinctive appendage at the base, and it produces clusters of pale purple or white flowers in the spring. It is a herbaceous perennial that thrives in well-drained soil and partial to full shade.
